content.body:
> <@akaster:serenityos.org> Maybe I'm supposed to run `processCustomFetchResponse` with response and a network error failure ðŸ¤”

I'm reading this as you're supposed to run `processCustomFetchResponse` with a network error and null
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @akaster:serenityos.org
Maybe I'm supposed to run processCustomFetchResponse with response and a network error failure ðŸ¤”
I'm reading this as you're supposed to run processCustomFetchResponse with a network error and null

content.body: Ah actually not. It's supposed to return a network error instead of the actual response
those "fetch hooks" are like a post-processor to whatever fetch gave you
you fetch the script like you do for a normal worker, and then run the "perform a fetch hook" as defined in the service worker spec on the response
